purpleculture_pinyin:
rào
to wind; to coil (thread); to rotate around; to spiral; to move around; to go round (an obstacle); to by-pass; to make a detour; to confuse; to perplex
дуть; наматывать (нарезать); вращаться вокруг; по спирали; передвигаться; объехать (препятствие); обходить; сделать объезд; смущать; озадачить
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 绕)
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 繞道 [ rào dào ]: to go by a roundabout route; to take a detour; (medicine or civil engineering) bypass

    • 堯 [ yáo ] a legendary ancient emperor-sage
heisig_chinese_memo: Spidey has had enough and starts killing the villains after he catches them.  Then he has to go around his pigpen and feed the villain to his pigs to dispose of the body.
Ru_trainchinese: rào: (глаг) обматывать, накручивать; двигаться кругами; обходить, объезжать; запутывать, сбивать с толку
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: For practice spiderman likes to go around in circles while the javelin thrower tries to hit him.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " Shi " and " Yao ", the original meaning is entanglement. "Shuowen": "Entangling. From Shito, Yaosheng." "Shanhaijing‧Overseas Western Jing": "(Qianshan) its hillside, four snakes surround each other."

" Round " can mean surround and surround. "Zhuangzi: Shuojian": "Around the Bohai Sea, and take Changshan Mountain."

" Round " also means to arrive from the side or back in a winding way. "Historical Records-General Wei Huqi Biography": "The strong wind blows up, the gravel hits the face, the two armies do not meet, and Han Yi flares the left and right wings."

" Ruo " can also be read in tones, indicating bending. "Selected Works‧Fu Yi's "Dancing Fu"": "The eyebrows are linked to increase the flow of the eye, and the eyes flow to look at the horizontal wave." Li Shan's note: "It is a song that is circumscribed.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " Shi " and " Yao ", the original meaning is entanglement.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「堯」聲，本義為纏繞。《說文》：「纏也。从糸，堯聲。」 《山海經‧海外西經》：「（窮山）其丘方，四蛇相繞。」

　　「繞」可表示環繞、圍繞。《莊子‧說劍》：「繞以渤海，帶以常山。」

　　「繞」還表示從側面或後面，曲折迂回到達。《史記‧衛將軍驃騎列傳》：「大風起，沙礫擊面，兩軍不相見，漢益縱左右翼繞單于。」

　　「繞」還可讀上聲調，表示彎曲。《文選‧傅毅〈舞賦〉》：「眉連娟以增繞兮，目流睇而橫波。」李善注：「繞謂曲也，言眉細而益曲也。」
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
繞 (Simplified: 绕)
Pinyin: rào
English Definition: to wind; to coil (thread); to rotate around; to spiral; to move around; to go round (an obstacle); to by-pass; to make a detour; to confuse; to perplex
Total strokes: 18; Radical: 糸
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 堯 [ yáo ] a legendary ancient emperor-sage
Example Words:
繞道 [ rào dào ]: to go by a roundabout route; to take a detour; (medicine or civil engineering) bypass
More: 繞* | *繞 | *繞*

HSK: 5
Freq: 8617
Chinese: Spidey has had enough and starts killing the villains after he catches them. Then he has to go around his pigpen and feed the villain to his pigs to dispose of the body.
Meaning: go around
Hanzi: 绕
Story: For practice spiderman likes to go around in circles while the javelin thrower tries to hit him.
Kind: traditional

從「 糸 」，「 堯 」聲，本義為纏繞。《說文》：「纏也。从糸，堯聲。」 《山海經‧海外西經》：「（窮山）其丘方，四蛇相繞。」 「 繞 」可表示環繞、圍繞。《莊子‧說劍》：「繞以渤海，帶以常山。」 「 繞 」還表示從側面或後面，曲折迂回到達。《史記‧衛將軍驃騎列傳》：「大風起，沙礫擊面，兩軍不相見，漢益縱左右翼繞單于。」 「 繞 」還可讀上聲調，表示彎曲。《文選‧傅毅〈舞賦〉》：「眉連娟以增繞兮，目流睇而橫波。」李善注：「繞謂曲也，言眉細而益曲也。」
From the sound of " Shi" and " Yao", the original meaning is entanglement. "Shuowen": "Entangling. From Shito, Yaosheng." "Shanhaijing‧Overseas Western Jing": "(Qianshan) its hillside, four snakes surround each other." " Round" can mean surround and surround. "Zhuangzi: Shuojian": "Around the Bohai Sea, and take Changshan Mountain." " Round" also means to arrive from the side or back in a winding way. "Historical Records-General Wei Huqi Biography": "The strong wind blows up, the gravel hits the face, the two armies do not meet, and Han Yi flares the left and right wings." " Ruo" can also be read in tones, indicating bending. "Selected Works‧Fu Yi's "Dancing Fu"": "The eyebrows are linked to increase the flow of the eye, and the eyes flow to look at the horizontal wave." Li Shan's note: "It is a song that is circumscribed.

繞字的基本解释

繞
rào
见“绕”。

繞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［rào］
［《廣韻》人要切，去笑，日。］
“绕1”的繁体字。
(1)缠绕；缭绕。
(2)引申指某事或某问题纠缠不清。
(3)围绕；环绕。
(4)不直接从正面过去，走曲折迂回的路。
[②]［rǎo］
［《廣韻》而沼切，上小，日。］
“绕2”的繁体字。
(1)弯曲。
(2)姓。春秋秦有绕朝。见《左传·文公十三年》。

繞字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　繞； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页939第14
【廣韻】而沼切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】爾紹切，?音擾。【說文】纏也。【干祿字書】遶，通繞。　又姓。【左傳·文十三年】繞朝贈之策。【註】繞朝，秦大夫。　又【集韻】人要切，音蟯。撓，或作繞。

繞字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
繞字的起名意思

暂无。

Around
Basic explanation of words
Around
rào
See "Round".
Around
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［rào］
["Guangyun" people want to cut, laugh, day. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "围1".
(1) Winding; winding around.
(2) By extension, it means that something or a problem is entangled.
(3) Surround; surround.
(4) Do not go directly from the front, take a winding road.
[②] [rǎo]
["Guangyun" and marsh cut, upper elementary school, day. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "圈2".
(1) Bending.
(2) Last name. In the Spring and Autumn Period, the Qin had a circumnavigation. See "Thirteen Years of Zuo Zhuan · Wengong".

[Zuo Zhuan·Wen Thirteen Years] The strategy of donating around the dynasty. [Note] Around the dynasty, Doctor Qin.　[Jiyun] People want to cut, sound pinch. Scratch, or make a winding.
